title: Netherlands Inflation Rate
description: Inflation Rate in Netherlands decreased to 14.30 percent in October from 14.50 percent in September of 2022. Inflation Rate in Netherlands averaged 3.27 percent from 1971 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 14.50 percent in September of 2022 and a record low of -1.30 percent in February of 1987. In Netherlands, the most important categories in the consumer price index are: housing, water, electricity and gas (24.5 percent of the total weight); transport (11.6 percent) and food and non-alcoholic beverages (11.3 percent). The index also includes: recreation and culture (10.3 percent); furnishing and household equipment (6 percent); clothing and footwear (4.9 percent); hotels and restaurants (4.2 percent); communication (3.3 percent) and alcoholic beverages and tobacco (3.1 percent). Health, education and other goods and services account for the remaining 20.8 percent of total weight. This page provides - Netherlands Inflation Rate - actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: Statistics Netherlands
